image.altText: A man with a beard wearing sunglasses takes a selfie

props.synopsis: A man has been found guilty of murdering his housemate by setting him on fire at their home in Adelaide's west in 2021.Â

title.children: Man who set housemate on fire found guilty of murder

image.altText: A queue of seven ambulances waiting outside a hospital.

props.synopsis: South Australia's ambulance union says ramping is happening at a major regional hospital, but Premier Peter Malinauskas disagrees.

title.children: Ambulances queued outside SA hospital not ramping, premier says

image.altText: Seven Network's logo on a building

props.synopsis: Regional residents in parts of South Australia and New South Wales could lose access to Seven Network channels on their TVs from next month after negotiations with WIN Network broke down.

title.children: Free-to-air AFL and  cricket could disappear from parts of SA and NSW

image.altText: A police officer unfurls crime scene tape.

props.synopsis: A 30-year-old woman arrested following a break-in in Adelaide's east is expected to be charged with the murder of a 65-year-old man whose body was found at a nearby unit, police say.

title.children: Woman charged with murder after man found at unit with stab wounds

image.altText: The headquarters of oil and gas company Santos.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government threatens to intervene if a nearly $30 billion takeover bid for the state's largest company Santos is "not in the interests of South Australians".

title.children: SA government threatens to intervene in Santos foreign takeover bid

image.altText: A man in a purple blazer leaves a court building surrounded by a media scrum

props.synopsis: A former SA Police detective who repeatedly abused his ex-wife has been jailed, with his victim demanding "comprehensive reforms" in the "ill-equipped" police force that she said ignored her cries for help.

title.children: Former police detective jailed for repeatedly assaulting ex-wife

image.altText: A man sits with game pieces on the table in front of him.

props.synopsis: In South Australia's regions where sport often reigns supreme, board-gaming circles are growing.

title.children: How a love of board games grew into a club meeting three times a week

image.altText: Woman looks straight at the camera with serious but calm expression, holding a ukulele

props.synopsis: Songs Inside is a music workshop program working with women in prisons, helping them access creative outlets and find purpose. A documentary telling their story has just won a prize at Sydney Film Festival.Â

title.children: A documentary about a women's prison music program just won a $20k prize

image.altText: Young children jump on circles and crosses lit up on the ground

props.synopsis: A decision to make smaller scale, immersive shows has helped Patch Theatre make profound impacts on Australian kids.

title.children: A change in direction has brought immersive theatre to children

image.altText: A close-up shot of a ram.

props.synopsis: A ram sold for a world record price of $450,000 back in 1989, but a Country Hour reporter remembers it as the peak before the fall for Australia's wool industry.

title.children: The $450,000 ram and what became of Australia's wool industry

image.altText: A female newsreader in Islamic head dress has a panicked look on her place

props.synopsis: A news anchor in Tehran is seen fleeing a TV studio as Israel and Iran launch missile strikes at each other as the conflict enters its fifth day.

title.children: Israelis vow Iran 'cannot break us' as Iranian state TV bombed live on air

image.altText: A front and back mock up of the gold trump iPhone

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and his family are getting into the telecommunications industry, but questions remain whether the marketed Made in the USA phone can actually be manufactured domestically.

title.children: Trump family unveils gold Made in America phone, mobile service

image.altText: Composite image of three screenshots of profiles on Instagram

props.synopsis: Racist comments mocking the victims flooded social media after the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad. Â

title.children: 241 died in the Air India crash â it triggered a flood of racist comments

image.altText: A green ceramic mug sits beside an open laptop displaying a conference call with a group of colleagues.

props.synopsis: Business groups say those who work from home should not expect to receive overtime and penalty rates if they have the flexibility to choose their own hours.

title.children: Union wants 'presumed' right to work from home, as Labor weighs new law

image.altText: Four people stand inside a big cave.

props.synopsis: Deep in the Blue Mountains, archaeologists uncover artefacts that reveal secrets of the nation's Ice Age past.Â

title.children: Hidden in a Blue Mountains cave are artefacts that change the story of a nation

image.altText: A small possum superimposed over a black background, showing a handdrawn aerial map

props.synopsis: A Victorian timber company is using what's been dubbed a "zombie" license from 1977 to log critically endangered mountain ash forest, including the habitat of the Leadbeater's possum, which was once thought extinct.

title.children: 'Death by a thousand cuts': Possum habitat logged using 1977 'zombie' permit

image.altText: Christine and her daughter Mia hug each other outside the front of their home.

props.synopsis: The proportion of Australian teenagers vaccinated against the virus that causes cervical cancer is the lowest it has been in almost 10 years.

title.children: Poor vaccine uptake a 'reality check' as situation worsening in Australia

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed human remains found almost two weeks ago are those of missing Queensland teenager Pheobe Bishop.

title.children: Human remains formally identified as missing teen Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: Glenn Horan arriving at court

props.synopsis: The prosecution alleges Inspector Glenn Horan suspected his then-partner, Senior Constable Celeste Batticciotto, was in a relationship with someone else.

title.children: Detective allegedly used police database to track former partner

image.altText: Frank and Delma sit side-by-side, holding hands, in front of an anniversary cake, decorated with their wedding photo.

props.synopsis: Delma and Frank Murray, who met at a Newcastle dance hall in 1939, have just celebrated their 80th wedding anniversary, making them Australia's oldest living married couple.

title.children: Australiaâs oldest couple recognised on 80th wedding anniversary

image.altText: Police officer in camouflage gear with sniper rifle next to heavy police truck.

props.synopsis: The Special Operations Group were there as "backup" at the scene of a fatal police shooting in Tasmania, but what happened on that day is yet to be revealed. So, what is the SOG and what part does it play in law enforcement?

title.children: What is the Special Operations Group police unit?

image.altText: Armand Duplantis looks up

props.synopsis: Pole vault legend Armand Duplantis keeps breaking his own record a centimetre at a time â and it keeps earning him the big bucks.

title.children: Why 1cm equals multiple big-money payouts for this record-breaking pole vaulter

image.altText: CCTV footage of a shooting in an Auburn kebab shop

props.synopsis: Employees can be seen ducking for cover as their target, crime boss Samimjan Azari, tries to dodge a hail of bullets from behind a chair.

title.children: 'Doesn't deserve this': Vision shows shocking failed underworld hit

image.altText: A close-up selfie photo of a man and a woman aged in their 50s.

props.synopsis: Wolfgang Raven Wildgrace, once linked to an ill-fated AFL pre-season camp for the Adelaide Crows, has been sentenced to jail after pleading guilty to sexually abusing two children. A court has heard he psychologically manipulated the girls over several years of offending.

title.children: Disgraced life coach jailed for child sex abuse, rape

image.altText: death cap mushroom

props.synopsis: NSW Health and local councils have warned people against eating wild mushrooms after detecting the growth of death cap mushrooms in the state.

title.children: Poisonous death cap mushrooms detected across NSW, warnings issued

image.altText: An indoor wall with lettering on it that reads "ACT Integrity Commission".

props.synopsis: An ACT Ombudsman report finds the territory's corruption watchdog did not comply with its own inherent purpose to effectively manage conflicts of interest after an investigation revealed it awarded its former CEO a $150,000 consulting contract while he was still in the top job.

title.children: CEO prepared own consulting contract without declaring conflict: Ombudsman

image.altText: A ladle scoops broth from a large steaming pot

props.synopsis: Would you eat a stew that has been cooking for days, weeks or even months? On social media, users are making perpetual stew and inviting others to share it.Â

title.children: 'Perpetual stew' is a medieval dish finding fans on TikTok

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Matthew Perry, wearing clear plastic-rimmed glasses, a black suit jacked and a grey v-neck shirt.

props.synopsis: One of the doctors accused of playing a role in Matthew Perry's death is expected to change his plea to guilty, admitting he injected the actor with ketamine on several occasions in the weeks leading up to his death.

title.children: Doctor admits injecting Matthew Perry with ketamine in exchange for cash

image.altText: A dark skinned man wearing black sunglasses with pursed lips

props.synopsis: Prosecutors showed videos at the heart of the case that the hip-hop mogul recorded during day-long, drug-fuelled sessions.Â

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial shown 'freak-off' sex marathon videos

image.altText: The hands of a person counting through piles of $100 US dollar notes

props.synopsis: Has America's descent into authoritarianism destroyed its reputation permanently?

title.children: Why global money is abandoning America

image.altText: Two women hug

props.synopsis: Advocates say a critical undersupply of housing has forced people onto the streets. But as more councils disperse homeless camps, rough sleepers are left with nowhere to go.

title.children: Housing crisis forces retiree out onto the streets to help the homeless

image.altText: A crowd of mostly men lean on a fence, holding pots and buckets.

props.synopsis: Israeli troops kill at least 23 Gazans waiting for food at an aid distribution site in Rafah, medics say.

title.children: Families mourn loved ones seeking food killed by Israeli forces at Gaza relief centre

image.altText: Man in a yellow shirt holding up a phone showing a photo of an older Indian woman with her grandchild.

props.synopsis: Imtiaz Ali Syed still can't bring himself to tell his mother that his brother was on board the Air India flight which crashed while taking off from Ahmedabad.

title.children: 'Haven't lost hope': Family holding out for miracle after Air India crash

image.altText: Alexander's daughter in the snow

props.synopsis: While the weather might be drastically different in Tasmania and the NT during winter, the social calendar is equally busy.Â

title.children: The magic of winter in Tasmania, and the 'chill' in Darwin
